page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: Our block comprises the large council housing estates of Hylton Castle, Town End Farm, part of Downhill, part of the village of Castletown and the farmland and grassland to the west of the A.19 a major north-south trunk road. The houses on Hylton Castle, Town end Farm and Downhill were built in the late 1950's and early sixties during a slum clearance programme. They were also built to house workers from the nearby factories. The houses in Castletown are older and were built to house miners working at the local colliery. Most of the houses are semi-detached, each with their own garden. The stone from Downhill Quarry is used for the foundations of roads and buildings.
